1.text: But of the times and moments, brethren, you need not, that we should write to you;

2.text: For yourselves know perfectly, that the day of the Lord shall so come, as a thief in the night.

3.text: For when they shall say, peace and security; then shall sudden destruction come upon them, as the pains upon her that is with child, and they shall not escape.

4.text: But you, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief.

5.text: For all you are the children of light, and children of the day: we are not of the night, nor of darkness.

6.text: Therefore, let us not sleep, as others do; but let us watch, and be sober.

7.text: For they that sleep, sleep in the night; and they that are drunk, are drunk in the night.

8.text: But let us, who are of the day, be sober, having on the breastplate of faith and charity, and for a helmet the hope of salvation.

9.text: For God hath not appointed us unto wrath, but unto the purchasing of salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ,

10.text: Who died for us; that, whether we watch or sleep, we may live together with him.

11.text: For which cause comfort one another; and edify one another, as you also do.

12.text: And we beseech you, brethren, to know them who labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you:

13.text: That you esteem them more abundantly in charity, for their workâ€™s sake. Have peace with them.

14.text: And we beseech you, brethren, rebuke the unquiet, comfort the feeble minded, support the weak, be patient towards all men.

15.text: See that none render evil for evil to any man; but ever follow that which is good towards each other, and towards all men.

18.text: In all things give thanks; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you all.

21.text: But prove all things; hold fast that which is good.

22.text: From all appearance of evil refrain yourselves.

23.text: And may the God of peace himself sanctify you in all things; that your whole spirit, and soul, and body, may be preserved blameless in the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

24.text: He is faithful who hath called you, who also will do it.

26.text: Salute all the brethren with a holy kiss.

27.text: I charge you by the Lord, that this epistle be read to all the holy brethren.

28.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
